Authors:
Xiang-Hua Wang, Zhen Wang, Zuohong Chen, Wangqiu Deng,
Tolgor Bau
Title:
Lactarius mirus sp. nov. (Russulaceae, Russulales), the first
species of Lactarius subg. Plinthogalus with yellowing latex in
China
Keywords:
species delimitation, fagaceous forests,
subtropical-tropical, taxonomy, geographical distribution
Abstract:
Species of Lactarius subg. Plinthogalus have latex often
changing to reddish. Yellowing latex is relatively rare. Lactarius
mirus, a species with white latex instantly changing to bright yellow
was found from fagaceous forests in central-southern China. This is the
first report of species with yellowing latex in L. subg. Plinthogalus in
China. Together with the unique latex, the brown pileus, distant
lamellae and big globose spores with high winged ornamentation
distinguish it from all other known species and we described it as a new
species here. DNA barcode nrITS-LSU region and morphological description
and illustrations are provided. Morphological differences between L.
mirus and the other species with yellowing latex, e.g.Â Malaysian L.
flavorosescens and L. pallidior are discussed. The finding of this
species adds new evidence showing the affinity between subtropical China
and the tropics.
